    LocalDateBox, LocalTimeBox, NumberBox

    public abstract class InputBox<VALUE>
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.ValueBoxBase<VALUE>
implements AttributeWriteDataList, AttributeWriteMaximumTextLength, AttributeWriteHtmlId
    A InputBox extends ValueBoxBase for HTML5 input widgets.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • getMaximumTextLength

        public int getMaximumTextLength()
        This method gets the maximum text length of this object. Will be Integer.MAX_VALUE if no maximum is defined.
        Specified by:
        getMaximumTextLength in interface AttributeReadMaximumTextLength
        Returns:
        the maximum number of characters a user is allowed to enter into this object (field).

      • setMaximumTextLength

        public void setMaximumTextLength(int length)
        This method sets the maximum text length of this object.
        ATTENTION:
        If you are setting this property on a UI field, the typical behavior is that after the maximum text length is reached, any additional input is ignored. This also applies for copy and paste operations. For usability this might be undesired in many cases as users can not append something and then remove a prefix afterwards if the length would be exceeded. Please consider using a validator instead and only use this feature in situations where it is really suitable.
        Specified by:
        setMaximumTextLength in interface AttributeWriteMaximumTextLength
        Parameters:
        length - is the new maximum text length to set. Use Integer.MAX_VALUE to unset.

      • getId

        public String getId()
        This method gets the unique identifier of this object.
        ATTENTION:
        In order to be compliant with all possible UI toolkit implementations, a valid ID has to fulfill ECMA-262, Section 7.6. It is recommended to use IDs of the form [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_$]*. Invalid IDs (e.g. containing colon, hash or period) are not accepted to prevent you from later having problems with CSS selectors.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface AttributeReadHtmlId
        Specified by:
        getId in interface AttributeReadId<String>
        Returns:
        the ID of this object.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadHtmlId.ID_SEPARATOR

      • setId

        public void setId(String id)
        This method set the ID of this object. Use this method to give the object a meaningful identifier after creation.
        ATTENTION:
        See javadoc of AttributeReadHtmlId.getId() for the syntax constraints of IDs.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
